item.description:
Senior Software Engineer - Cloud Computing Software

Job Id: ELAS-SCENG

As a Senior Software Engineer in the Component Engineering team at ELASTRA, you will play the pivotal role of being a key contributor to the worldÂ’s first infinitely scalable software application infrastructure. Our product goes a step beyond hardware virtualization, providing the software and on demand service that scales our comprehensive solution to support tens of thousands of virtual machines.

Why you will love this job:

  • Cloud computing software! You'll have the opportunity to work on an innovative, new software in an exploding area of computing
  • As a successful, growing and well funded early stage company, a position here will keep you on your toes - you'll have variety of work, work with the newest technologies, and your skills and career will continue to grow with the organization
  • Working here comes with a variety of unique benefits including a lunch cost splitting program, a downtown San Francisco office space perfect for commuters, and off-site team meetings for top performing teams

As a Senior Software Engineer you will work within our Agile development model and be accountable for quickly translating business requirements into functional code and components deployed on the cloud. You will design and develop tools and services for software components development, provisioning and management that will be used by our customers within the ELASTRA infrastructure. In this role you will also be responsible for design and development of parts of the component service platform and infrastructure.

What you need to be successful in this role:

  • Clear understanding of the software development life-cycle and object-oriented design
  • Extensive development experience with Java/J2EE and dynamic languages like Python and/or Ruby
  • Experience building web service APIs - SOAP and/or REST
  • Exposure to Java libraries - concurrent utilities (threads), JMS, JDBC
  • Exposure to XML - XML Schema, XML Parsing (DOM, SAX, Stax)
  • Solid understanding of REST architectural principles
  • Good working knowledge of databases, connectors, app servers and Web stacks
  • Experience writing unit, integration and performance tests using testing tools and frame works such as Junit, TestNG, Jmeter, Rspec etc.
  • Experience with Agile development models
  • Proven Experience in designing architectures using J2EE/REST and coding them
  • Experience with Semantic web technologies such as RDF and SPARQL a definite plus
  • Ability to solve problems, self-starter mentality and desire to work in a team-centric, and coach others in a collaborative environment
Take this opportunity to go a step beyond hardware virtualization, building a robust, fault-tolerant system that will solve application and system infrastructure needs more completely!

About ELASTRA

ELASTRA provides software for designing, deploying, and managing complete application systems in public and private cloud computing environments. Our products simplify and automate the complex processes associated with database and application infrastructure design, deployment and management, while elastically-scaling sophisticated application systems up and down based on computing need. We thrive in an innovative and creative environment fueled by talented individuals who are eager and able to make a contribution to a product positioned to revolutionize the way companies and individuals utilize computing resources and run their IT operations. We are excited to be expanding our team exponentially due to the success and projected market growth for our product. ELASTRA is backed by Amazon.com, Bay Partners, and Hummer Winblad Venture Partners. For more information on the company or our offering please visit our website at www.elastra.com.

To apply for this position or refer someone you know, please use our online interview system managed by Accolo.

Apply for this job

Once you have completed the interview, your information will be forwarded to the hiring authority for decisions on next steps.
